required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Indoor Daylight Photo Dynamic Therapy for Actinic Keratosis
clinical_study.official_title: Indoor Daylight Photo Dynamic Therapy (PDT) for Actinic Keratosis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to understand better if indoor daylight Photo Dynamic Therapy (PDT) can provide effective lesion clearing versus conventional red lamp light therapy.

detailed_description.textblock:
Subjects who enroll into this research study, their participation in this study will last up to 6 months. They will be asked to return to the clinic 3-4 times.
Subjects will be randomized into one of two study arms:
Arm 1 - Indoor Daylight PDT Therapy Arm 2 - FDA Approved Standard Light Therapy Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Changes or clearing of the lesions
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, immediately post-procedure (2 hours) and one and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: The primary aim of this study is to study if indoor daylight PDT can be as effective as regular lamp light PDT. This study can be confounded by the amount of PpIX produced in the lesions as well as the clearing of lesions at one month and six months.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the amount of PpIX in the lesion
primary_outcome.description: Secondary diagnostic study to determine if low-cost cellphone-based skin dosimetry in PDT can facilitate objective measurement of drug levels.

arm_group.description: Ameluz will be applied to skin. This will be followed by a 30-minute incubation period. Subsequently, you will be exposed to natural sunlight through a window for 2 hours. Post-treatment assessments will be performed and you will be given instruction on appropriate sun protection methods.

arm_group.arm_group_label: FDA Approved Standard Light Therapy Treatment
arm_group.description: Ameluz will be applied to skin. This will be followed by a 30-minute incubation period. Subsequently, you will receive Red Light Treatment for 10 minutes. Post-treatment assessments will be performed and you will be given instruction on appropriate sun protection methods.

intervention.description: Amulez and sun exposure for 2 hours
Amulez and red light treatment for 10 minutes
intervention.arm_group_label: FDA Approved Standard Light Therapy Treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients with actinic keratosis appearing at the Dermatology Clinic for PDT treatment.
- Age ≥ 18 years old and ≤ 75 years old.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women or women who are breast-feeding.
- Any patients with a condition that makes them not suitable for clinical PDT.
